revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-22 09:37:24.000000000', 'message': 'Local IP: OVS agent part

OVS agent will collect Local IP associations updates
via push notifications mechanism and handle them during port update:

- setup local ARP responder
- setup local ip translation flows (nat via conntrack)
- setup local gARP blocker to prevent undesired Local IP ARP updates
  from other nodes (and from real IP address owner)

2 new OF tables added for br-int:

- LOCAL_EGRESS_TABLE - to save local ports vlans
- LOCAL_IP_TABLE - for local ip handling

Partial-Bug: #1930200
Change-Id: I49923958d1d602e3af4e02fadbec1b17798c49c8

commit_message:
Add Local IP L2 extension flows

- setup local ARP responder
- setup local ip translation flows (nat via conntrack)
- setup local gARP blocker to prevent undesired Local IP ARP updates
  from other nodes (including real IP address owner)

2 new OF tables added for br-int:

- LOCAL_EGRESS_TABLE - to save local ports vlans
- LOCAL_IP_TABLE - for local ip handling

Partial-Bug: #1930200
Change-Id: I49923958d1d602e3af4e02fadbec1b17798c49c8

commit_message:
Enable DB purge cron job after database is initialized

The DB purge operation expects the target database is already
initialized. This change ensures db sync is completed before cron job
is enabled.

Closes-Bug #1955829
Change-Id: Ib3ed541ee0b3a513efe961ba6142a0cbb09ee61a

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary dependency

Current Ceilometer doesn't provide API, thus it doesn't use policy
files.

Change-Id: I3006a03d788df043151655589fb57e027e0bd9e2

commit_message:
Load libraries in a single place

This change refactors how the dependent libraries are loaded during
unit tests, and load the libraries in the base spec_helper to avoid
duplicate and redundant implementations.

Change-Id: I59d8a5794a2f9c27ef231a22c38e507364e2e1a8

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-30 11:45:48.000000000', 'message': 'Adding unversioned notification publish mechanism

Some applications listens to nova RabbitMQ for compute events, but
the interface attachment and detachment events are not compatible with
the unversioned notification mechanism. Looking into other events
handling code blocks, for example, delete instance  manager method is
implemented with both notifiers (unversioned and versioned). The
documentation points out that they are published to diffent RabbitMQ
topics and there is a key value pair defined in the openstack armada
manifest configuring the notification mechanism, can be unversioned,
versioned or both.

Closes-Bug: #1956036

Signed-off-by: Iago Estrela <IagoFilipe.EstrelaBarros@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I8d7dfbd176ad92288efe1c2bee1b7066e28dd7ce
'}]
commit_message:
Adding unversioned notification publish mechanism

Some applications listens to nova RabbitMQ for compute events, but
the interface attachment and detachment events are not compatible with
the unversioned notification mechanism. Looking into other events
handling code blocks, for example, delete instance  manager method is
implemented with both notifiers (unversioned and versioned). The
documentation points out that they are published to diffent RabbitMQ
topics and there is a key value pair defined in the openstack armada
manifest configuring the notification mechanism, can be unversioned,
versioned or both.

Closes-Bug: #1956036

Signed-off-by: Iago Estrela <IagoFilipe.EstrelaBarros@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I8d7dfbd176ad92288efe1c2bee1b7066e28dd7ce

commit_message:
Add ovn_sb_connection to octavia.conf

This commit added ovn_sb_connection to octavia.conf otherwise it will
try to connect to ovn-sb-db using the default address which is
127.0.0.1 while the ovn-sb-db listen on the IP address of the
api_interface.

Closes-Bug: #1950111

Change-Id: I9cb9a0365d00ffd70562b4b3e83493ec09bd52c2

[{'created': '2021-12-28 08:19:05.000000000', 'message': 'Clean virtualenv only when inventory is not retained

When both -X(clean venv) and -I(retain inventory) options
are passed, both these options are exclusive to each other,
so proposing to clean venv only when inventory is not to
be retained.

Change-Id: I7e49fea95d3d7767dd3fb0564e032bae48368b5b
'}]
commit_message:
Clean virtualenv only when inventory is not retained

When both -X(clean venv) and -I(retain inventory) options
are passed, both these options are exclusive to each other,
so proposing to clean venv only when inventory is not to
be retained.

Change-Id: I7e49fea95d3d7767dd3fb0564e032bae48368b5b

[{'created': '2021-12-28 05:04:24.000000000', 'message': "Pass valid IP address to os-brick

While fetching connector information the cinder driver of
glance-store is passing 'hostname' as IP address whereas it
actually needs IP address.

This path fetches the IPV4 or IPV6 address from the available
'hostname' and passes it to os-brick.

This worked for other cinder backends which don't rely specifically
on IP address for initializing connection like fibre channel, nfs etc
and even for some iscsi backends since, in some environments,
the hostname is same as the ip address. This is not the case always
and we should pass the correct IPv4/IPv6 address of the host to
avoid this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1955668

Change-Id: Ic79815972e654a8bfe2775f57c68cfa0bf115e2f
(cherry picked from commit 8b4d97a6f7ce0805a430dac6756495db7a5aacb4)

Conflicts:

	glance_store/tests/unit/test_cinder_store.py
	glance_store/tests/unit/test_multistore_cinder.py
"}]
commit_message:
Pass valid IP address to os-brick

While fetching connector information the cinder driver of
glance-store is passing 'hostname' as IP address whereas it
actually needs IP address.

This path fetches the IPV4 or IPV6 address from the available
'hostname' and passes it to os-brick.

This worked for other cinder backends which don't rely specifically
on IP address for initializing connection like fibre channel, nfs etc
and even for some iscsi backends since, in some environments,
the hostname is same as the ip address. This is not the case always
and we should pass the correct IPv4/IPv6 address of the host to
avoid this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1955668

Change-Id: Ic79815972e654a8bfe2775f57c68cfa0bf115e2f
(cherry picked from commit 8b4d97a6f7ce0805a430dac6756495db7a5aacb4)
(cherry picked from commit 83d9c5dc2e4ca4edb29970d0543f7e9c574c0911)
Conflicts:
	glance_store/_drivers/cinder.py
	glance_store/tests/unit/test_cinder_store.py
	glance_store/tests/unit/test_multistore_cinder.py

commit_message:
Enable DB purge cron job after database is initialized

The DB purge operation expects the target database is already
initialized. This change ensures db sync is completed before cron job
is enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1955829
Change-Id: I389d966623894c23fe596bec9e4942f3beee8303

commit_message:
Load libraries in a single place

This change refactors how the dependent libraries are loaded during
unit tests, and load the libraries in the base spec_helper to avoid
duplicate and redundant implementations.

Change-Id: Iaa74d6b229fdf5089983c5b9f99341fa9f5cd671

subject: Fix auth ID caps for manila with ceph-mgr

This review [1] tests the auth change here in combination with the ceph create-from-volume change.  There we see authorization problems for 'ceph fs subvolume create ...' [2].

@Ramana - would you double check the caps?  They are set here in the job cited [3].


[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/782954

[2] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/898b67c20f6d4a37933732993e48feac/log/controller/logs/screen-m-shr.txt#358-366

[3] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/898b67c20f6d4a37933732993e48feac/log/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt#16867"}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2021-03-29 22:32:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for checking this Tom! Seems we need to tweak those a bit.

In any case, wanted to follow us on this. How much benefit do we see on testing with this caps? The older caps are more permissive, so they will work with the new implementation. If we want to test this caps, we would need to implement a check on the manila version that is being used.

What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2021-03-29 22:32:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2021-03-29 23:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@vicky - Well I think this review will be very helpful so that we can figure out exactly what CAPS are right and we can document it.  Then when we know what is right, we can see if doing version checking and using two different CAPS in CI makes sense.

Thanks for testing it in this review!'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2021-04-06 19:00:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8056, 'date': '2021-04-08 22:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> This review [1] tests the auth change here in combination with the ceph create-from-volume change.  There we see authorization problems for 'ceph fs subvolume create ...' [2].
> 
> @Ramana - would you double check the caps?  They are set here in the job cited [3].
> 
> 
> [1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/782954
> 
> [2] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/898b67c20f6d4a37933732993e48feac/log/controller/logs/screen-m-shr.txt#358-366
> 
> [3] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/898b67c20f6d4a37933732993e48feac/log/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt#16867

Thanks, Tom. I'd to change MON caps from 'allow r' to 'allow rw' to make the current manila driver code. This is not what we want. I'd to make the following simple change in the driver code that works with this patch,

diff --git a/manila/share/drivers/cephfs/driver.py b/manila/share/drivers/cephfs/driver.py
index dd430553..1cc83ebb 100644
--- a/manila/share/drivers/cephfs/driver.py
+++ b/manila/share/drivers/cephfs/driver.py
@@ -149,7 +149,8 @@ class RadosError(Exception):
     pass
 
 
-def rados_command(rados_client, prefix=None, args=None, json_obj=False):
+def rados_command(rados_client, prefix=None, args=None, json_obj=False,
+                  target=('mon-mgr', )):
     """Safer wrapper for ceph_argparse.json_command
 
     Raises error exception instead of relying on caller to check return
@@ -172,12 +173,13 @@ def rados_command(rados_client, prefix=None, args=None, json_obj=False):
     argdict['format'] = 'json'
 
     LOG.debug("Invoking ceph_argparse.json_command - rados_client=%(cl)s, "
-              "prefix='%(pf)s', argdict=%(ad)s, timeout=%(to)s.",
-              {"cl": rados_client, "pf": prefix, "ad": argdict,
+              "target=%(tg)s, prefix='%(pf)s', argdict=%(ad)s, timeout=%(to)s.",
+              {"cl": rados_client, "tg": target, "pf": prefix, "ad": argdict,
                "to": RADOS_TIMEOUT})
 
     try:
         ret, outbuf, outs = json_command(rados_client,
+                                         target=target,
                                          prefix=prefix,
                                          argdict=argdict,
                                          timeout=RADOS_TIMEOUT)
@@ -712,7 +714,8 @@ class NativeProtocolHelper(ganesha.NASHelperBase):
 
     def get_mon_addrs(self):
         result = []
-        mon_map = rados_command(self.rados_client, "mon dump", json_obj=True)
+        mon_map = rados_command(self.rados_client, "mon dump", json_obj=True,
+                                target=('mon', ))
         for mon in mon_map['mons']:
             ip_port = mon['addr'].split("/")[0]
             result.append(ip_port)


We want the above change to go into manila cephfs driver code ASAP.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2021-04-09 11:23:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2021-04-09 11:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2021-04-09 11:58:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This is working with https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/785623 -- there are a couple of failures in the native CephFS job but I don't see any cases where the driver can't interact properly with the back end for lack of caps."}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2021-04-09 14:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

What about previous stable branches Tom?'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2021-04-09 14:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Good point, I was being too enthusiastic :D  Are you planning to make the change specific to Wallaby and after?'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-04-09 15:23:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The QA team will discuss whether it makes more sense to just branch devstack-plugin-ceph. The containers plugin is branching to avoid this headache of "do we have the older branches covered", so we can do the same for ceph. These are our two major plugins so it makes sense to branch them with DevStack IMHO. Please let us know your thoughts too.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2021-04-09 15:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The containers plugin is branching to avoid this headache of "do we have the older branches covered", so we can do the same for ceph. Offhand, I think branching makes lots of sense.  We could make the plugin code itself cleaner and even make more fundamental changes with e.g. a development branch to take advantage of new Ceph features without so much concern about fitting them into the legacy structure of the plugin.'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2021-04-09 16:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Have you seen an error with this caps in some env?"}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-23 13:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Dmitriy Rabotyagov <noonedeadpunk@ya.ru>
'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-23 13:14:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Thanks for the review Dmitriy! MDS caps shouldn't be needed for manila in either case. API and scenario tempest tests are passing for both cephfs native and cephfs nfs with the proposed caps. Have you seen an error with this caps in some env?

Hm... But I mean for native case something should create and mount CephFS share? And a new client should be created for each project or smth like that?
But I think I missed another release note, which would be related to https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/branch/master/manila/share/drivers/cephfs/driver.py#L94-L101"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-04-27 23:04:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > Thanks for the review Dmitriy! MDS caps shouldn't be needed for manila in either case. API and scenario tempest tests are passing for both cephfs native and cephfs nfs with the proposed caps. Have you seen an error with this caps in some env?
> 
> Hm... But I mean for native case something should create and mount CephFS share? And a new client should be created for each project or smth like that?
> But I think I missed another release note, which would be related to https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/branch/master/manila/share/drivers/cephfs/driver.py#L94-L101

Nope, you don't need to create the /volumes directory by hand (or with automation) - you needn't do it even previously. "/volumes" was a top level directory that the driver automatically created in the past where it would place all the manila share groups and shares under. Previously the manila CephFS driver would create subdirectories under this top level directory and export them as shares/share groups. However, Ceph now internalized this concept of exporting subdirectories on a filesystem as "Subvolumes". So, Manila shares are now analogous to 
"CephFS subvolumes" - a concept that's got growing support in Ceph itself. The top level directory if any is still abstracted away from you as the end user (or the deployer) - you needn't worry about it. 

Is there any place in openstack-ansible where you were creating this top level "/volumes" directory?'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-28 09:34:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > But I think I missed another release note, which would be related to https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/branch/master/manila/share/drivers/cephfs/driver.py#L94-L101
> 
> Nope, you don't need to create the /volumes directory by hand (or with automation) - you needn't do it even previously. "/volumes" was a top level directory that the driver automatically created in the past where it would place all the manila share groups and shares under. Previously the manila CephFS driver would create subdirectories under this top level directory and export them as shares/share groups. However, Ceph now internalized this concept of exporting subdirectories on a filesystem as "Subvolumes". So, Manila shares are now analogous to 
> "CephFS subvolumes" - a concept that's got growing support in Ceph itself. The top level directory if any is still abstracted away from you as the end user (or the deployer) - you needn't worry about it. 
> 
> Is there any place in openstack-ansible where you were creating this top level "/volumes" directory?

Yeah, there was as otherwise tempest test was failing back then https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_manila/src/branch/master/tasks/manila_backend_cephfs.yml#L27-L31. I think it's fixed at the moment anyway, so already suggested patch to drop it'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-12-30 14:38:21.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Radosław Piliszek.'}]

commit_message:
Fix auth ID caps for manila with ceph-mgr

Now that we issue mgr/volume commands and rados
get/put on pool with "ganesha_rados_store_pool_name"
name via a rados client, the auth ID used by the
driver/rados client would need different capabilities.

The auth ID will now require:

mon 'allow r'
mgr 'allow rw'
osd 'allow rw pool=<ganesha_rados_store_pool_name>"

The driver's auth ID does not need any MDS capability,
requires reduced MON and OSD capability, and extra write
capability for MGR.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/785623

Partially-Implements: bp update-cephfs-drivers

Co-Authored-By: Victoria Martinez de la Cruz <victoria@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ramana Raja <rraja@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tom Barron <tpb@dyncloud.net>
Change-Id: Icfd973fd2829fee8e3e611ad1e23031a4afc4151

commit_message:
Run tempest-slow job on devstack gate

tempest-slow job runs slow marked tempest tests
which are not part of tempest-full job. tempest-slow
jobrun on project side gate(master as well on stable)
so it is better to start running the tempest-slow job
on devstack gate also to catch any failure due to
devstack changes.

Change-Id: I5f5e844419df6a8e46793d55bb5103661093030b

messages:

did you test locally? because opensuse is no longer tested in CI'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-05-18 12:50:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I did not test locally given that I assumed it is a direct replacement and also that the RPM package name even matches the one in Red Hat family distributions and so does the RPM file list. However, you raise a good point. It seems the pcp-system-tools RPM provided by openSUSE does not create an alternative (symbolic link) to the 'dstat' CLI. Red Hat family RPMs do:

[root@ba3419720db9 /]# ls -l /usr/bin/dstat 
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 30 Jul 21  2020 /usr/bin/dstat -> /usr/libexec/pcp/bin/pcp-dstat"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-12-30 14:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Radosław Piliszek.'}]

Change-Id: Ie26a13a15c05778c572d1837af775566e99398e0
'}, {'created': '2021-12-29 17:06:52.000000000', 'message': "Install wheel explicitly python3 venv is used

[1] Switched to python3 native venv in CentOS 9,
virtualenv created by python3 -m venv don't install
wheel by default, so we would need to install that
explicitly.

Without wheel installer tries to do legacy install
and with that uninstall/reinstall of a project
may clean files owned by another project in shared
directories.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/813624

Closes-Bug: #1955574
Change-Id: Ie26a13a15c05778c572d1837af775566e99398e0
"}]
commit_message:
Install wheel explicitly python3 venv is used

[1] Switched to python3 native venv in CentOS 9,
virtualenv created by python3 -m venv don't install
wheel by default, so we would need to install that
explicitly.

Without wheel installer tries to do legacy install
and with that uninstall/reinstall of a project
may clean files owned by another project in shared
directories.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/813624

Closes-Bug: #1955574
Change-Id: Ie26a13a15c05778c572d1837af775566e99398e0

commit_message:
Load libraries in a single place

This change refactors how the dependent libraries are loaded during
unit tests, and load the libraries in the base spec_helper to avoid
duplicate and redundant implementations.

Change-Id: I92ba82bfba4ab4e47e0f704ea71433cd98fc03d2

commit_message:
Make tempest-multinode-full-py3 job as voting

tempest-multinode-full-py3 job is stable now and
voting on Tempest gate.

Let's make this jobs as voting on devstack gate too.

Change-Id: Id47094b592c143260b0586b636c514bec44c55d0

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints from in review changes

Currently upper-constraints.txt is not getting used
from in-review changes of requirements project and
leading to merge of broken requirements[1].

Use master branch to fetch constraints instead of
the remote branch.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/822575

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/823128
Change-Id: I5d42ac6b54bf20804d7e5faa39d1289102318b64

commit_message:
Enable oslo.limit to be installed from git repo

oslo.limit isn't currently in the list of libraries that can be
installed from a git repo via LIBS_FROM_GIT.

This adds oslo.limit to enable integrated testing against unmerged
oslo.limit changes.

Change-Id: I26cc567fdf4c84014040ae586bbb029b8de7a236

messages:
[{'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2017-08-02 16:53:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Those steps from the tc resolution are for community support removal and are independent of devstack. The postgres support in devstack is deprecated, mostly unmaintained, untested, and it will be removed. I'm not sure if someone was planning on doing it in pike (it's getting kinda close) but the deprecation statement is still valid. If people want to continue to support postgres with devstack they can write a devstack plugin that sets up postgres after it is removed."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2017-08-02 17:12:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Those steps from the tc resolution are for community support
 > removal and are independent of devstack. The postgres support in
 > devstack is deprecated, mostly unmaintained, untested, and it will
 > be removed. I'm not sure if someone was planning on doing it in
 > pike (it's getting kinda close) but the deprecation statement is
 > still valid. If people want to continue to support postgres with
 > devstack they can write a devstack plugin that sets up postgres
 > after it is removed.

OK, if that's the case, I'd expect the removal from devstack to trigger a cleanup in project-config too where a number of PG related jobs are defined (e.g. neutron periodically tests against postgres).

I mainly triggered this patch to understand the latest state of affairs. I am fine with either outcome. I'll keep this patch open for a tad longer to gather more feedback.

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2017-08-02 17:14:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > Those steps from the tc resolution are for community support
 > > removal and are independent of devstack. The postgres support in
 > > devstack is deprecated, mostly unmaintained, untested, and it
 > will
 > > be removed. I'm not sure if someone was planning on doing it in
 > > pike (it's getting kinda close) but the deprecation statement is
 > > still valid. If people want to continue to support postgres with
 > > devstack they can write a devstack plugin that sets up postgres
 > > after it is removed.
 > 
 > OK, if that's the case, I'd expect the removal from devstack to
 > trigger a cleanup in project-config too where a number of PG
 > related jobs are defined (e.g. neutron periodically tests against
 > postgres).
 > 
 > I mainly triggered this patch to understand the latest state of
 > affairs. I am fine with either outcome. I'll keep this patch open
 > for a tad longer to gather more feedback.
 > 
 > Thanks

Oh, we also run a functional job against postgres on a continuous basis. When this is actually removed it'd be nice to have a heads up otherwise that'll cause havoc to the neutron CI :)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-02 19:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Matthew,

i don't understand "mostly unmaintained, untested" argument.
can you explain?
when i run devstack, i mostly use postgresql.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2017-08-03 00:20:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

When you look at the gate we don't test devstack changes on postgres. Nor do the majority of the projects out there test with it. (neutron apparently being the exception) Also, the amount of people looking at the code is very limited. I can't remember the last time I saw a postgres change or bug filed in devstack. Even if there was one I honestly wouldn't be comfortable reviewing it without any of that testing. If it's not tested it's broken. While you might be using it successfully that doesn't really reflect it's status. It was deprecated for all of these reasons, and it's disingenuous to our users to say it's something we're supporting moving forward."}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2017-08-03 00:29:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

my understanding is that it isn't tested on gate because it's deprecated. it can't be a reason to deprecate it."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2017-08-04 16:02:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> When you look at the gate we don't test devstack changes on
 > postgres. Nor do the majority of the projects out there test with
 > it. (neutron apparently being the exception) Also, the amount of
 > people looking at the code is very limited. I can't remember the
 > last time I saw a postgres change or bug filed in devstack.

That's because it just works and there's really no reason why it breaks :)

 > there was one I honestly wouldn't be comfortable reviewing it
 > without any of that testing. If it's not tested it's broken. While
 > you might be using it successfully that doesn't really reflect it's
 > status. It was deprecated for all of these reasons, and it's
 > disingenuous to our users to say it's something we're supporting
 > moving forward.

Personally I was mainly surprised by the fact that the removal of this DB backend is suggested for Pike. I am not advocating to keep it in the devstack tree, but removal based on the outcome of the TC resolution seems unjustified in my humble opinion at this point.

Many things are not tested in the gate in devstack, but turning everything into a plugin seems counterproductive, especially if there's not much of an overhead in keeping the login in tree."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2017-09-13 14:53:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Matthew, you're raising valid points about lack of CI, but the outcome of the TC resolutionw as different, and the wording of that change is incorrect anyway, support was not removed in pike."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2017-09-13 14:54:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I think here the revert is for now the correct thing to do, and I'd love to look into some more postgresql checks"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2017-09-19 15:23:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-19 17:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

I was also surprised to find this. The deprecation patch in d9aaae95f2b84170bf35e037715e4963d89f940c gave no background, but I assumed it was tied to the TC resolution.

There are jobs that rely on it so I don't see a reason to deprecate it, especially if it's not causing problems. We don't have a lot of postgresql bugs, no, but if one were reported, it's pretty easy to test the fix (it doesn't have to be on every single change, i.e. integrated gate)."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-17 19:58:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-17 20:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I was surprised by that as well.

 > Also, HI ARMAX!

HI ALL!'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-10-18 01:24:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

We have pg jobs and when they break, testing a fix is better than deprecating. When they don't break, there is no need to deprecate."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-10-18 01:35:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-10-18 11:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Revert "Generate deprecation warning for postgresql"

Based on resolution [1], there's no clear indication that next
steps involve the removal of the DB from Devstack or from the gate.

[1] I332cef8ec4539520adcf37c6d2ea11488289fcfd

This reverts commit d9aaae95f2b84170bf35e037715e4963d89f940c.

Change-Id: I8410d65c0e0b24035aa035fac7560a686d53ec50

commit_message:
Use MDB backend in Ubuntu

The MDB backend is the default in Ubuntu and specifying
HDB in debconf doesn't change it to HDB.

Closes-Bug: #1939700
Change-Id: If98f7fc8395678365fb73f0c5cd926cef083e470

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-12-30 05:45:19.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup keystone library

IDENTITY_API_VERSION is hardcoded to 3 in most locations already, drop
the remaining occurrences, but keep the variable definition since some
plugins still depend on it. Drop ENABLE_IDENTITY_V2 which no longer
has any effect.

Amend variable list for bootstrap_keystone().

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: I06f476d2105bc6ec2b511fc5effcfcc3973eaf97
(cherry picked from commit 95555ba39827e2f3648eb89bde91b1342c493306)
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup keystone library

IDENTITY_API_VERSION is hardcoded to 3 in most locations already, drop
the remaining occurrences, but keep the variable definition since some
plugins still depend on it. Drop ENABLE_IDENTITY_V2 which no longer
has any effect.

Amend variable list for bootstrap_keystone().

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: I06f476d2105bc6ec2b511fc5effcfcc3973eaf97
(cherry picked from commit 95555ba39827e2f3648eb89bde91b1342c493306)
